section.title: Introduction
section.para: This article describes how to run &kvm; &vmhost; on the &alp; (&alpshort;).

section.title: Starting the &kvm; workload
section.para: &alpshort; can serve as a host running virtual machines. The following procedure describes steps to prepare the &alpshort; host to run containerized &kvm; &vmhost; and run an example &vmguest; on top of it.

step.para: Retrieve the following files from &obs;: kvm-container.conf, kvm-functions, and kvm-container-manage.sh. You can do so either by downloading them directly from https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/home:aginies:branches:SUSE:ALP:Workloads/kvm-container, or by running the following osc checkout:
Install all needed files to manage the container:
Pull the &kvm; server image, create its container, and start it:
Run a &vmguest; on top of the started &kvm; &vmguest; using the virt-install.sh script.

tip.para: virt-install.sh uses the openSUSE-Tumbleweed-JeOS.x86_64-OpenStack-Cloud.qcow2 image by default. To specify other VM image, modify the APPLIANCE_MIRROR and APPLIANCE options in the kvm-container.conf file.
